title: Improved IMF synth - opinions?
content:
Hi everyone,

I think I've finally figured out Hocus Pocus generates that cool stereo effect with its music, and I've managed to duplicate it in my own IMF player. I'm curious as to whether anyone else likes the sound of it, so here are a few rough clips of some well known IMFs played through it. Please compare it to your current IMF player and let me know if you like my improvements!

[url=http://www.shikadi.net/opl/vulture.ogg]vulture.ogg[/url] (1.7MB - original [url=http://www.shikadi.net/opl/vulture.imf]vulture.imf[/url] from Monster Bash)

[url=http://www.shikadi.net/opl/track24.ogg]track24.ogg[/url] (696kB - original [url=http://www.shikadi.net/opl/track24.imf]track24.imf[/url] from Keen 6)

You'll probably notice the effect most if you listen on headphones.

title: Re: Unknown
content:
Ah yes... I've done a few MIDI files like that... It really is a neat effect. Clyde's Revenge is also done like that.

[url=http://www.mediafire.com/?fb0932jvs31]www.mediafire.com/?fb0932jvs31[/url]

title: Re: Unknown
content:
Uh...this topic is 2 years old. Why necro it?------------------

A member of the LevelLord fan club.

title: Re: Alas
content:
Wow, has it really been two years? Maybe I should release it, imperfections and all. I added .dro support the other day for playing DOSBox captures, and I still want to add CMF support.

I'll see how I go this weekend.[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Alas
content:
Well, CMF would be fine, since the only plugin I'm aware of (XMMS) that supports it is Adplug, but conflicts with Amidiplug (right name?) stealing its .mid association.------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.

title: Re: Alas
content:
I want that player. Give. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mort.gif[/img] [img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: Alas
content:
Yeah, I have the same problem with XMMS. I wrote a plugin years back to play .mid files through Timidity [hmm, don't even have a link for it any more], but Adplug takes over because .mid and .cmf are treated the same thanks to the same Adplug handler playing both formats. (And the Adplug author wasn't so keen on splitting them out.)

Interestingly enough, my IMF plugin steals all its extensions from Adplug, which must be because it appears first in the alphabetically sorted list of plugins - so if you recompiled Adplug to report its same as "zAdplug" then it shouldn't steal any extensions from other plugins...[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Alas
content:
It's interesting how badly designed is XMMS about plugin priority. There should be something like a customized plugin load order instead of the alphabetical thing; XMMS is kind of out-dated anyway...------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/meta/projectpage.htm]The META engine for 2D games[/url].

title: Re: Alas
content:
Well, much to my surprise I think I've got CMF playback nailed now. It was a lot easier than I thought too - and a bit weird, I always thought of CMF as the 'holy grail' of Adlib music formats when I was growing up, and this is the first time I've ever attempted to write a player for it, so the fact that it's working so well means I'm feeling pretty pleased with myself right about now [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

Heh, it really puts Adplug to shame too [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mort.gif[/img] [url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Alas
content:
Link?[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: Alas
content:
There are still a couple of bugs I'd like to iron out first. I managed to fix some long-standing issues with the harmonic Adlib synthesis, so that seems to be working perfectly now, but the CMF player still wants to play a couple of instruments an octave or two too low, and I'm not sure why - hopefully I'll figure it out today and then upload it somewhere.

Don't forget that it's Linux only though, so if you're not using XMMS you'll have to bug someone to port it to Winamp (maybe Shadow Master?)[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Alas
content:
...

I've never programmed with Winamp's API, nor I knew about it.
Better to port XMMS to Windows, don't you think so? IIRC, GTK+ 1 has a Windows port like GTK+2 does so all we'd have to do is to replace XMMS' ALSA & OSS output plugins with Win32 Audio plugin and abracadabra. Or not?------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/meta/projectpage.htm]The META engine for 2D games[/url].

title: Re: Alas
content:
Is there any reason you prefer XMMS over Audacious, Malvineous? I've found the latter much more usable. It'd be nice if there existed a Linamp port... Winamp has much more functionality than what I've seen of its Linux equivalents (granted, it's been about six months since I last used Audacious).

Though of course, adding in the necessary functionality to XMMS or Audacious would be much simpler than porting the entire Winamp code to Linux.

</rant>

title: Re: Alas
content:
I've never tried Audacious. Is it GTK2 or something else based?
The only reason because of which I use XMMS is it's weight. It doesn't interfere with any application, no matter what kind of file I'm playing, and most sophisticated plugins seem to be designed solely for XMMS (i.e. modplug, adplug, Malv's and amidiplug, although the last one can be built for Audacious and BMP too). Besides, it allows you to change volume, move in the playlist, etc. via the command line, without creating new instances of the player; useful if you have a multimedia keyboard and lineakd installed.------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/meta/projectpage.htm]The META engine for 2D games[/url].

title: Re: Alas
content:
There's no need - XMMS was a clone of Winamp, so the plugin architecture is almost identical (assuming Winamp hasn't changed its architecture in the last few years...)

At any rate the API is pretty straightforward, so I doubt you'd have any trouble, and you would learn quite a few new things in the process if you've never done it before![url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Alas
content:
OK, I'll just have to setup a Win2000 installation in QEMU to have it handy when the source code is released.

I've always wondered what kind of .MID files Adplug can read. It associates them under the same category of CMF files, but all MIDI files I happen to have cannot be played thru it. Was all this for some weird flavour used in games I don't have?------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/meta/projectpage.htm]The META engine for 2D games[/url].

title: Re: Alas
content:
Oh whoops, I didn't realise there was a second page of posts when I replied last [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img]

I think Adplug can only read Type-0 MID files (single track), not Type-1 (multitrack, most common) or Type-2 (multisong.)

I've never heard of Audacious either - but I agree with SM, XMMS is lightweight and doesn't interfere with anything. BTW, I've never heard of lineakd, but I wrote a hotkey plugin for XMMS years back too, so that I could use the Internet navigation keys on my keyboard for XMMS control. I'm not sure what the performance is like when you use the command line (from memory it's not so great) but this is *instant* [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] [url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Alas
content:
AFAIS, command line-driven hotkeys don't affect performance. Lineakd was more useful for me because I didn't require to have XMMS running to play a song, i.e. pressing the Play button in keyboard automatically launches XMMS to play the last song.

I have not setup lineakd again because of several reasons:
1. not enough time
2. I'm switching back to Suse linux next week, so tweaking the system config in Mandriva now will only give me more files to backup. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img] ------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/meta/projectpage.htm]The META engine for 2D games[/url].

title: Re: Alas
content: Ah ok, I guess that suits you better then.  I never close XMMS unless I'm testing something (like reloading the IMF plugin) so I don't need a hotkey to load it.  (Plus if I used a hotkey I wouldn't be able to see all the debug messages, which is why I load it from a terminal.)<font color="#EEF2EE">[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]</font>

title: Re: Alas
content:
I only launch it from a text terminal if something crashes or doesn't work properly (i.e. I thought it was Amidiplug's fault for not sending the MIDI output to Tim). However, you can always do (IIRC):

xmms 1> ~/xmms_stderr.txt

If you want to see what's going on but don't want a terminal window in your desktop.

OK, when are you going to release the source? I'm kind of impatient, really. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mischief.gif[/img] ------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/meta/projectpage.htm]The META engine for 2D games[/url].

title: Re: Alas
content:
Nah, I find redirecting the output to a file is too tedious for continual debugging, and since I have a small terminal window on my secondary monitor all the time, it may as well display XMMS debugging messages while it's there.

I still want to tidy things up a bit before I release the source. Last night I finally fixed the last real bug in the CMF player which now allows the Vinyl Goddess From Mars music to play perfectly, but there's still one or two little bugs in there that cause an unexpected note to play here and there, and one song in particular has a couple of notes missing at the start (but I'm not sure yet whether that's a bug in the CMF player or a bug in the Vinyl Goddess music converter.)

So hopefully this weekend - only a week late [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Released at last!
content:
Okay, it's been a long time coming, so here at last is the [url=http://www.shikadi.net/utils/xmms.html]first release of my improved XMMS synth[/url].

I got carried away again last night and added the ability to seek in IMF, DRO and RAW files (so hopefully that will keep Shadow Master happy, as that was one comment he made during testing) but seeking is still on the 'to do' list for CMF files. I don't think there are any major issues remaining, but have a look at the TODO file for a list of things that are still outstanding.

Again, this is a source-only release for XMMS, so if you're not using Linux you'll have to wait a bit longer until someone ports it to Winamp. All eyes on Shadow Master [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] (seriously though, all that needs to be done is a little tweaking of xmms-adlib.cpp and adding a few lines of code to CriticalSection.cpp.) Please post about it here if anyone does start porting it, and if you run into trouble I'll see how much I can remember from my days of Windows programming...

But those of you who can run it, let me know what you think![url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Released at last!
content:
Yep, programming in Linux makes one forget Windows programming and stuff. What the hell is a HANDLE??

I'll try to port it only if there's people interested in a Winamp port, otherwise I'll just concentrate in my game engine. I really can't afford working on two things at the same time. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img]

Besides, I'd have to install Winamp under WINE or something to test a winamp port of the plugin, I just can't go back to Windows whenever I need to test a program. It's not the Linux boot/reboot time, but Windows' (15 minutes aprox.)

I'll download the source code and build it for my own amusement in XMMS anyway.------------------------------

title: Re: Released at last!
content:
You should look into QEMU's savestates, you can boot Windows and then take a snapshot of it, so that next time you want to get into Windows you can just load that snapshot and it only takes a few seconds to get up and running.

Don't bother porting it if you'd rather work on your game engine though - I may even have a go at porting for old times' take down the track if I'm in the mood...[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Released at last!
content:
You've got my interest, anyone tried alerting the wider community of this?[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: Released at last!
content:
Definitely, please release this!

For someone who's interested in recording IMF's digitally (say, for MP3 soundtracks), a good IMF synth emulator is essential- I have OPL soundcards but trying to record on my Pentium 1 doesn't produce good results :P

Thumbs most definitely up!

- Spike

title: Re: Released at last!
content:
I have some trouble building it in my system. G++ complains about your use of (for example):

[pre] class CFunkyClass {public:<!--EZCODE BOLD START--><strong>CFunkyClass::</strong><!--EZCODE BOLD END-->CFunkyClass();<!--EZCODE BOLD START--><strong>CFunkyClass::</strong><!--EZCODE BOLD END-->~CFunkyClass();};[/pre]

Complains specifically about the bold part. The compiler should just issue a warning IMO, but it kind of hates that redundant syntax in constructors and destructors prototype declaration and issues an error instead. I'm using GCC 4.something. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img]

And more serious errors arise later if I fix that part. Am I missing a dependency? What should install in that case?------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/meta/projectpage.htm]The META engine for 2D games[/url].

title: Re: Released at last!
content: That's odd, but I'm using GCC 3.2.3.  Can you post the errors or e-mail them to me?  Try removing the -Wall parameter from the Makefile, it should make GCC quieter about noncritical errors.<font color="#EEF2EE">[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]</font>

title: Re: Released at last!
content:
I'm sure that only makes it quieter about warnings, not error. Perhaps I should try with GCC 3, I think I installed it at some point.

Here's the log:
[url=http://shadowm.rewound.net/xmms-adlib-build]Download this log file[/url]------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/meta/projectpage.htm]The META engine for 2D games[/url].

title: Re: Released at last!
content:
That's quite odd...what happens if you add this at the top of CPlayCMF.h:

#include <math.h>

That should fix the pow() etc. errors, but the error about the virtual function in CPlayFile.h isn't supposed to happen - it's an abstract base class. You could try adding this function into CPlayFile.h:

virtual ~CPlayFile();

But then you'll probably get an undefined reference when you get right to the end of the compile (or a crash when a file finishes playback), so you might need to create that function and put it in one of the .cpp files:

CPlayFile::~CPlayFile()
{
}

But to me it looks like a bug in GCC - are you sure you're using a stable release?[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Released at last!
content:
Not sure at all, as it's a prebuilt version shipped with Mandriva Free 2007.0. I'll switch back to Suse next week and see what happens, although I bet it uses the same GCC version. It still sounds strange, as the Linux kernel is in 2.6.22 but Mandriva includes 2.6.17 (a more "stable"* version), so it seems like they wouldn't give me an unstable GCC. Oh right, release notes, haven't checked.

* nightmarish pain in the ass kernel version; crashes whenever I play a MIDI thru Timidity's ALSA server, whenever I use 3D acceleration too intensively; additionally, the keyboard gets stuck at sending no key signals if it's used intensively------------------------------
